instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Hi.

Liquid damaged board, corrosion to <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> cleaned up and replaced.

No S5 and no S5 enables.
PPBUS = 8.27V

Bad SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: PPBUS is with battery only or charger only or both connected???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 12800"]PPBUS is with battery only or charger only or both connected???[/QUOTE]

Charger only.

I was thinking with no S5 enabes and PPBUS a little low it would be SMC. You thinking somethig else?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: This is not "a little low" it is too low, check ISL area, sense resistors, Voltage on pin 2, seems more like a bad ISL than a bad SMC.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: 8.27 is too low. Do you have a green and the orange light?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: EDIT: answered but tiered, will check for sure in morning

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: Green only, one wire 3V3 no communication

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: Looks like SMC issue. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> high? 3V42 checked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
I ran it through the Crest UC which I think cleared some crap from the trackpad connector.

Machine working. Thanks for your helps guys
